0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Determine accurate duty calculations for imported goods to ensure compliance with regulations.
Interpret and apply relevant laws, treaties, and trade agreements governing international trade.
Verify the authenticity and accuracy of commercial invoices, bills of lading, and other trade documents.
Facilitate smooth clearance of shipments by communicating effectively with customers, carriers, and government agencies.
Identify and resolve discrepancies or delays in customs processing to minimize shipment downtime.
Conduct research on emerging trends, policies, and regulations affecting international trade and customs procedures.
Develop and maintain knowledge of relevant laws, treaties, and agreements impacting customs procedures.
Prepare and submit required paperwork, including export and import forms, for customers' shipments.
Coordinate with carriers to ensure timely pick-up and delivery of shipments.
Negotiate with customs officials to resolve issues or reduce delays in shipment processing.
Provide expert advice to customers on customs regulations, procedures, and compliance requirements.
Maintain accurate records of shipments, including documentation, manifests, and tracking information.
Monitor and report on changes in customs regulations, policies, or procedures to ensure customer compliance.
Develop and implement strategies to reduce costs associated with customs clearance for clients.
Collaborate with colleagues to share knowledge, best practices, and expertise in customs brokerage.
Analyze data from shipments to identify trends and areas for improvement in customs clearance efficiency.
Prepare and submit requests for ruling or letter of interpretation on behalf of customers.
Conduct site visits to assess customer operations and provide recommendations for process improvements.
Participate in industry events, conferences, and workshops to stay current on regulatory changes and network with peers.
Analyze bills of lading, commercial invoices, and other trade documents for accuracy and completeness.
Verify the export and import classification of goods using Harmonized System (HS) codes or other relevant classification systems.
1: Design and implement a comprehensive onboarding program for new hires, aiming to achieve a 95% job satisfaction rate within the first 6 months of employment.
Develop and maintain a training curriculum aligned with organizational goals and industry standards, resulting in a 25% increase in employee skills and knowledge.
Conduct regular departmental performance reviews to identify skill gaps and recommend targeted training interventions.
Establish partnerships with external training providers to offer specialized courses and workshops that meet the needs of diverse employee groups.
Create a learning management system (LMS) to centralize all training materials, track progress, and facilitate self-directed learning.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to create engaging and interactive training content, ensuring a 90% participant satisfaction rate in classroom sessions.
Manage the budget for training initiatives, allocating resources effectively to achieve desired outcomes and optimize ROI.
Develop and implement a metrics-driven evaluation framework to assess training program effectiveness and inform future improvements.
Facilitate cross-functional teams to develop shared learning objectives, fostering collaboration and alignment across departments.
Design and deliver leadership development programs to equip managers with skills necessary for effective team management and strategic planning.
Provide coaching and mentoring support to employees on the job, aiming to enhance their confidence, skills, and overall performance.
2: Prepare high-quality meals for students and staff in a timely manner.
Refrigerate and store food products according to safety guidelines and institutional regulations.
Maintain a clean and organized kitchen environment, adhering to health standards.
Develop and implement new menu ideas to cater to diverse dietary requirements.
Assist with food preparation during special events and catering services.
Supervise kitchen staff and promote teamwork to ensure efficient service.
Monitor inventory levels of ingredients and reorder supplies as necessary.
Ensure compliance with food safety regulations and guidelines.
Maintain accurate records of ingredient usage, waste, and menu planning.
Collaborate with nutritionists and healthcare professionals to develop healthy menus.
Provide exceptional customer service to patrons in the cafeteria or dining hall.
Perform daily cleaning and sanitizing tasks to maintain a sanitary environment.
